713028f-a.text: 42nd Street, north side, east from but not including Sixth Ave. 1880. Brown Brothers.

713025f-a.text: 42nd Street, north side, west from but not including Fifth Ave. About 1896.

713027f-a.text: 42nd Street, north side, west from but not including Fifth Ave, to but not including Sixth Ave. About 1900.

713034f.text: 29-61 West 42nd Street, north side, west from the middle of the block to the corner of Sixth Avenue. The building at No. 43-45 is the Harmonie Club. The original Interborough subway line is in the early stages of construction. April 29, 1901. Board of Transportation. William B. Parsons Collection.

713024f.text: 21, 23, 25 West 42nd Street, north side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. 1918 or 1919. Gift of E. M. Jenks.

713042f-a.text: W. 42nd Street (foreground, from left center to the right margin) at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Sixth Avenue (left and upon which appears a northward view for 3 blocks ). Shown is a general view north eastward towards the East River with its Queensboro and Hell Gate Bridges. Thru the midground runs Fifth Avenue (note St. Patricks Cathedral thereon) with its absence of towering structures at this date. 1919. Ewing Galloway.

713032f-a.text: 35, 33-29, 25, C3, 21-15 West 42nd Street, north side, between Sixth and Fifth Avenues, showing the new Aeolian Hall at 33-29 West 42nd Street. The Hell Gate Bridge is seen on the horizon to the right. About 1921. Edwin Levick.

713130f-a.text: 42nd Street at Twelfth Avenue, view west. May 17, 1927. P. L. Sperr.

713018f-b.text:
1. Bristol Building, formerly Bristol Hotel, 42nd Street at N.W. corner of Fifth Avenue. August 15, 1929.

2. The same, a close-up of the demolition work. December 31, 1929.

3. The same, seen from the steps of the New York Public Library. December 31, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

713020f-a.text: 42nd Street, north side, west from and including Fifth, to but not including Sixth Aves. Also shown is Fifth Ave., at the N.W. corner of 42nd Street. About 1930. Irving Underhill.

713021f-a.text: 42nd Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Fifth Ave. Also shown is Fifth Ave., west side, north from 42nd, to and including 45th Streets. About 1930. Irving Underhill.

710766f-b.text:
View 1: Coneral Transatlantic line. April 14, 1931.

View 2: Twelfth Avenue west side from West 42nd to West 43rd, showing the New York Central Freight Station. April 14, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

710766f-a.text:
View 1: Coneral Transatlantic line. April 14, 1931.

View 2: Twelfth Avenue west side from West 42nd to West 43rd, showing the New York Central Freight Station. April 14, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

734542f-a.title: North (Hudson) River - Manhattan - 12th Avenue - Pier between 41st and 42nd Streets.
734542f-a.text: North (Hudson) River, showing the pier (center of view) between West 42nd and West 41st Streets, off Twelfth Ave. (no pier number). This pier was demolished between 1930 and 1934. Also shown (extreme right) is part of pier 81. The view is in a southwesterly direction from the edge of the West New York (N.J.) Ferry at the foot of West 42nd Street. April 8, 1931. P. L. Sperr.
734542f-a.folder: Manhattan - 12th Avenue - Pier between 41st and 42nd Streets., Hudson River, Manhattan, NY

717919f-b.text:
1. Bryant Park, northern side, looking east along 42nd Street, showing tree planting and reconstruction work in the Park. April 30, 1934.

2. The same, later in the year, showing the men cleaning up the
debris. August 20, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

717921f-a.text:
1. Planting trees in the process of remodelling Bryant Park, under the regime of Park Commissioner Robert Moses, showing the northern side of the Park, looking east on 42nd Street. April 30, 1934.

2. The same. April 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

713131f-a.text: New York Railways Company carbarn, 655-657 West 42nd Street, adjoining the N.E. corner of Twelfth Avenue, with a 34th Street crosstown car in the doorway. March 20, 1935. P. L. Sperr.

713037f-b.text:
1. 61-29 West 42nd Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Sixth Ave., as seen from Bryant Park. The corner building, Nos. 61-47 (left) is the Bryant Park Arcade; the adjoining building (center) is Stern Bros. Dept. Store, (Nos. 45-35), and the building on the right is the Morris Plan Building (Nos. 33-29) which was formerly Aeolian Hall. August 1935.

2. A view mainly of Sterm Bros. Dept. Store. August 1935.

3. A view of the Morris Plan Building. August 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

713037f-c.text:
1. 61-29 West 42nd Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Sixth Ave., as seen from Bryant Park. The corner building, Nos. 61-47 (left) is the Bryant Park Arcade; the adjoining building (center) is Stern Bros. Dept. Store, (Nos. 45-35), and the building on the right is the Morris Plan Building (Nos. 33-29) which was formerly Aeolian Hall. August 1935.

2. A view mainly of Sterm Bros. Dept. Store. August 1935.

3. A view of the Morris Plan Building. August 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

712765f-a.text:
1. East 42nd Street, north side, west from the East River, showing piles of old street car rails on an empty lot, and farther west the 23-story Prospect tower, on the east side of Prospect Place, between 42nd and 43rd Streets. In the background is visible the Chrysler Building, at the N.E. corner of Lexington Ave. March 31, 1937.

2. A detail of No. 1, viewing slightly northward, showing across the piles of old street car rails the north side of East 43rd Street, west to First Ave. These buildings are all units of the United Dressed Beef Co., a meat supply corporation. March 31, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

712765f-b.text:
1. East 42nd Street, north side, west from the East River, showing piles of old street car rails on an empty lot, and farther west the 23-story Prospect tower, on the east side of Prospect Place, between 42nd and 43rd Streets. In the background is visible the Chrysler Building, at the N.E. corner of Lexington Ave. March 31, 1937.

2. A detail of No. 1, viewing slightly northward, showing across the piles of old street car rails the north side of East 43rd Street, west to First Ave. These buildings are all units of the United Dressed Beef Co., a meat supply corporation. March 31, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

712766f-b.text: East 42nd Street, north side, at the East River, viewing northward, showing the abattoirs and meat packing houses there. Beyond are the apartment houses constituting the Beekman Hill and Sutton Place residential areas. The latter nestles at the foot of the Queensboro Bridge. September 28, 1940. Panorama set: 1-2. P. L. Sperr

712766f-a.text: East 42nd Street, north side, at the East River, viewing northward, showing the abattoirs and meat packing houses there. Sperr

713127f-b.text: West 42nd Street, north side, east of Twelth Avenue, showing an enclosed California orange tree growing at the car parking lot at this location. The owner pays a fee for the privilege. October 27, 1940. No's. 1-2. George D. Chinn.

713127f-a.text: West 42nd Street, north side, east of Twelth Avenue, showing an enclosed California orange tree growing at the car parking lot at this location. The owner pays a fee for the privilege. October 27, 1940. No's. 1-2. George D. Chinn.

710765f-b.text:
Twelfth Avenue, north across West 42nd Street, showing the West Side Vehicular Highway under construction. View 2 details the pedestrian activity on 42nd Street. The individuals shown are moving eastward after their arrival on the Weehawken Ferry from New Jersey. No. 3 is similar to View 1, showing completion of structural work at this point.

1-2: May 30, 1934.
3: October 20, 1939.

P. L. Sperr

710767f-b.text:
Twelfth Avenue, east side, north from West 42nd Street. The billboards in the foreground enclose the frontage extending from 42nd to 43rd Streets.

March 17, 1929.
September 5, 1930.
August 29, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

710768f-b.text: Twelfth Avenue, east side, north from West 42nd Street. View 2 details the billboard frontage extending from 42nd to 43rd Streets. Note the absence of the elevated West Side Vehicular Highway. April 8, 1931. No's. 1-2. P. L. Sperr.

710768f-a.text: Twelfth Avenue, east side, north from West 42nd Street. View 2 details the billboard frontage extending from 42nd to 43rd Streets. Note the absence of the elevated West Side Vehicular Highway. April 8, 1931. No's. 1-2. P. L. Sperr.

710772f-b.text:
Twelfth Avenue, west side, at W. 42nd Street, looking south from near W. 44th Street and showing piers. In the center is the freight station of the West Shore Railroad, pier 83.

View 1:  Eugene L. Armbruster Collection. April, 1924
View 2:  P. L. Sperr. April 14, 1931.

712767f-a.text:
East 42nd Street, south side, at the East River, showing the ventilator building to the new Queens-Midtown Tunnel lying between 41st and 42nd Streets. View 2 is from the first mentioned point. This is to the rear of the old Consolidated Edison Company structures that line the east side of First Avenue.

1: September 28, 1940.
2:  July 23, 1939.

P. L. Sperr.

712767f-b.text:
East 42nd Street, south side, at the East River, showing the ventilator building to the new Queens-Midtown Tunnel lying between 41st and 42nd Streets. View 2 is from the first mentioned point. 712932f.text: East 42nd Street, showing the Train House of Grand Central Station. Langill, 10 East 14th Street.

713022f.text:
42nd Street, west across Fifth Avenue (foreground) as photographed from the Lincoln Building. Bryant Park and the New York Public Library on the left, face the 500 Fifth Avenue Building, Salmon Towers, Aeolian Hall and Stern Brothers Department Store. The 6th Avenue "El" station appears st the top. 1938-9. Alexander Alland.

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N.Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alexander Alland, IRGV.

713030f.text: 42nd Street, east from 29 West 42nd Street, the West Presbyterian Church, between Sixth and Fifth Avenues, with Bryant Park and the ruins of the old reservoir at the right. The original Interborough subway line is in tho early stages of construction. April 29, 1901.

713100f-a.text: The new Times Square $1,000,000 Post Office erected for the U.S. government by A. E. Lefcourt. 340 West 42nd St.

713128f-b.text:
1. 42nd Street, east from and including Twelfth Avenue, showing the McGraw Hill Building, east of Ninth Avenue, under construction. April 8. 1931.

2. The same, two years later. This is the terminus of both the 42nd and the 34th Street crosstown surface lines. August 29, 1933.

3. The same, another year later. A section of the West Side Elevated Highway is under construction overhead. May 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

713128f-a.text:

713129f-a.text:
42nd Street, east from, but not including, Twelfth Avenue.
August 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

717936f-c.text:
1. Bryant Park, center and west side, towards 42nd Street, giving a rear view of the Federal Hall replica, on which demolition is beginning. April 8, 1933.

2. The same view, but closer to 42nd Street, showing the Park being remodelled under the regime of Commissioner Robert Moses, New York's first city-wide Commissioner of Parks. March 15, 1934.

3. The same, seen from the south side, and showing the Park after completion of the work. The flower beds are planted with ivy. The large corner building, at Sixth Avenue and 42nd Street, is the department store of Stern Brothers. July 6, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

717936f-a.text:

2. The same view, but closer to 42nd Street, showing the Park being remodelled under the regime of Commissioner Robert Moses, New York's first city-wide Commissioner of Parks. March 15, 1934.

3. The same, seen from the south side, and showing the Park after completion of the work. The flower beds are planted with ivy. The large corner building, at Sixth Avenue and 42nd Street, is the department store of Stern Brothers. July 6, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
